intro: Kryptostoma occlusum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small annual herb that typically grows in dry, sandy soils. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact cluster. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. Kryptostoma occlusum is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
